sources.title: Articles on Smashing Magazine ‚Äî For Web Designers And Developers

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Kristian Mikhel)
articles.description: Discover the importance of critical reflective practice and challenge some beliefs about reflection and its role in our work and growth. Kristian Mikhel suggests a critical reflective routine for individual contributors and gives some practical recommendations that will make reflection meaningful and actionable.
articles.title: The Art Of Looking Back: A Critical Reflection For Individual Contributors

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Michal Halperin Ben Zvi)
articles.description: With an estimated one in every eight individuals worldwide surpassing the age of 60, who are actively adopting online shopping, the need for user-friendly interfaces tailored to their needs becomes apparent. Explore the guidelines to help you design inclusive products for all, particularly for an older audience and your future self.
articles.title: Designing Age-Inclusive Products: Guidelines And Best Practices

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Geoff Graham)
articles.description: CSS is evolving faster than ever. With all of the new features that are now available ‚Äî and forthcoming ‚Äî since we got Flexbox and Grid years ago, the way we write CSS is evolving, too. In this article, Geoff Graham shares which features have had the most influence on his current approaches to CSS, as well as those that have not (at least yet).
articles.title: Writing CSS In 2023: Is It Any Different Than A Few Years Ago?

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Devin Harold)
articles.description: Accelerate your organization‚Äôs growth and innovation with the power of Rapid Research. From inception to implementation, here is the step-by-step roadmap on how to build the program from scratch and uncover the untapped ROI opportunities waiting to propel your initiatives to new heights.
articles.title: How To Create A Rapid Research Program To Support Insights At Scale

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Drew McLellan)
articles.description: In this episode of The Smashing Podcast, we‚Äôre talking about The Transitional Web. What is it, and how does it describe the technologies we‚Äôre using? Drew McLellan talks to Chris Ferdinandi to find out.
articles.title: Smashing Podcast Episode 63 With Chris Ferdinandi: What Is The Transitional Web?

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Andy Budd)
articles.description: In this article, Andy Budd, curator of UX London and Leading Design conferences, outlines some of the things that make a potentially amazing presentation, as well as a few big gotchas. If you‚Äôve ever wondered what it takes to get a speaking slot at a conference, this article is for you.
articles.title: How To Become A Better Speaker At Conferences

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Temani Afif)
articles.description: CSS has all kinds of tricks that are capable of turning images into neat, interactive elements. This article is a collection of fancy 3D effects for images that demonstrate those CSS powers.
articles.title: Shines, Perspective, And Rotations:¬†Fancy¬†CSS¬†3D Effects¬†For¬†Images

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Robert Goesch)
articles.description: As of today, the world‚Äôs 50 top airlines have all agreed on the same flight search pattern. Yet the path to booking the right flight remains frustrating and confusing. Is there really only one solution? Explore the thought experiment which turned the seemingly untouchable pattern on its head and offered new food for thought.
articles.title: The UX Of Flight Searches: How We Challenged Industry Standards

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cosima Mielke & Geoff Graham)
articles.description: How can we create products and experiences that don‚Äôt cause harm to the planet and to the people who use them? What do we need to consider to make more sustainable design decisions and reduce the carbon footprint of our websites? In this post, we compiled valuable resources that will get you familiar with the principles of sustainable design.
articles.title: Sustainable Design Toolkits And Frameworks

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cosima Mielke)
articles.description: Let‚Äôs welcome the new month with some fresh desktop wallpapers. Designed by artists and designers from around the globe, they come in versions with and without a calendar for July 2023. Enjoy!
articles.title: Off To New Adventures (July 2023 Wallpapers Edition)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Vitaly Friedman)
articles.description: The design process is messy. You might be following a structured approach, but too often, it takes a life of its own. And before you know it, you are designing in chaos, with last-minute changes and missed deadlines. So, what‚Äôs the ‚Äúperfect‚Äù design process?
articles.title: What‚Äôs The Perfect Design Process?

articles.description: Let‚Äôs discover the most popular DevTools tips that can boost your productivity and revolutionize your debugging workflow.
articles.title: Useful DevTools Tips and Tricks

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Geoff Graham)
articles.description: The Wikipedia team shipped a redesign of the ubiquitous and one of the [most visited websites](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_most_visited_websites) on the web. Alex Hollender and Jon Robson led the work and generously discussed the effort with us in a thorough, wide-ranging interview that covers the design, development, and processes that went into the project.
articles.title: Behind The Curtains Of Wikipedia Redesign

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Miko≈Çaj Dobrucki)

articles.title: How to Integrate ChatGPT with Google Sheets Using Google Apps Script

articles.title: How to Join the #100daysofOSS Challenge and Embrace the Power of Open Source

articles.author: Md. Fahim Bin Amin
articles.description: Creating projects is the best way to learn a programming language. It is fun and it's a creative way to learn new things.  Whenever I try to learn a new language or new technology, I try to create a project, whether it's a small byte-sized or big project.
articles.title: Python Project ‚Äì How to Convert Multiple Images into a Single PDF File

articles.description: In JavaScript, the HTML DOM (Document Object Model) represents the structure and content of an HTML document as a tree-like structure. articles.title: How to Manipulate HTML and CSS Using JavaScript

articles.description: At some point in your design career, you may hear about Information Architecture (or IA). You might even have to create a userflow or sitemap. Now, this article aims to help you go back to the basics and remind you of the meaning and importance of IA. So if you
articles.title: What is Information Architecture? How to Create Userflows and Sitemaps for UX Design

articles.description: In JavaScript, two objects may not be equal even though they appear to be similar. Why is that the case? ü§î Let's understand why. For example: const obj1 = {   name: "Dillion" } const obj2 = {   name: "Dillion" } console.log(obj1 === obj2) // false As
articles.title: Why Are Two Similar Objects Not Equal in JavaScript?

articles.description: Are you looking to add a touch of modernity to your Python apps? articles.title: Modern Python App Design with ttkbootstrap

articles.title: CLI Shells ‚Äì A Brief History of Human-Computer Interfaces
